27#ifndef HB_SUBSET_PLAN_HH
28#define HB_SUBSET_PLAN_HH
29
30#include "hb.hh"
31
32#include "hb-subset.h"
33#include "hb-subset-input.hh"
34#include "hb-subset-accelerator.hh"
35
36#include "hb-map.hh"
37#include "hb-bimap.hh"
38#include "hb-set.hh"
39
40namespace OT {
41struct Feature;
42}
43
44struct head_maxp_info_t
45{
46 head_maxp_info_t ()
47 :xMin (0x7FFF), xMax (-0x7FFF), yMin (0x7FFF), yMax (-0x7FFF),
48 maxPoints (0), maxContours (0),
49 maxCompositePoints (0),
50 maxCompositeContours (0),
51 maxComponentElements (0),
52 maxComponentDepth (0),
53 allXMinIsLsb (true) {}
54
55 int xMin;
56 int xMax;
57 int yMin;
58 int yMax;
59 unsigned maxPoints;
60 unsigned maxContours;
61 unsigned maxCompositePoints;
62 unsigned maxCompositeContours;
63 unsigned maxComponentElements;
64 unsigned maxComponentDepth;
65 bool allXMinIsLsb;
66};
67
68typedef struct head_maxp_info_t head_maxp_info_t;
69
70struct hb_subset_plan_t
71{
72 HB_INTERNAL hb_subset_plan_t (hb_face_t *,
73 const hb_subset_input_t *input);
74
75 ~hb_subset_plan_t()
76 {
77 hb_face_destroy (face: source);
78 hb_face_destroy (face: dest);
79
80 hb_map_destroy (map: codepoint_to_glyph);
81 hb_map_destroy (map: glyph_map);
82 hb_map_destroy (map: reverse_glyph_map);
83
84#ifdef HB_EXPERIMENTAL_API
85 for (auto _ : name_table_overrides)
86 _.second.fini ();
87#endif
88
89 if (inprogress_accelerator)
90 hb_subset_accelerator_t::destroy (p: (void*) inprogress_accelerator);
91 }
92
93 hb_object_header_t header;
94
95 bool successful;
96 unsigned flags;
97 bool attach_accelerator_data = false;
98 bool force_long_loca = false;
99
100 // For each cp that we'd like to retain maps to the corresponding gid.
101 hb_set_t unicodes;
102 hb_sorted_vector_t<hb_pair_t<hb_codepoint_t, hb_codepoint_t>> unicode_to_new_gid_list;
103
104 // name_ids we would like to retain
105 hb_set_t name_ids;
106
107 // name_languages we would like to retain
108 hb_set_t name_languages;
109
110 //layout features which will be preserved
111 hb_set_t layout_features;
112
113 // layout scripts which will be preserved.
114 hb_set_t layout_scripts;
115
116 //glyph ids requested to retain
117 hb_set_t glyphs_requested;
118
119 // Tables which should not be processed, just pass them through.
120 hb_set_t no_subset_tables;
121
122 // Tables which should be dropped.
123 hb_set_t drop_tables;
124
125 // The glyph subset
126 hb_map_t *codepoint_to_glyph; // Needs to be heap-allocated
127
128 // Old -> New glyph id mapping
129 hb_map_t *glyph_map; // Needs to be heap-allocated
130 hb_map_t *reverse_glyph_map; // Needs to be heap-allocated
131 hb_map_t glyph_map_gsub;
132
133 // Plan is only good for a specific source/dest so keep them with it
134 hb_face_t *source;
135 hb_face_t *dest;
136
137 unsigned int _num_output_glyphs;
138 hb_set_t _glyphset;
139 hb_set_t _glyphset_gsub;
140 hb_set_t _glyphset_mathed;
141 hb_set_t _glyphset_colred;
142
143 //active lookups we'd like to retain
144 hb_map_t gsub_lookups;
145 hb_map_t gpos_lookups;
146
147 //active langsys we'd like to retain
148 hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, hb::unique_ptr<hb_set_t>> gsub_langsys;
149 hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, hb::unique_ptr<hb_set_t>> gpos_langsys;
150
151 //active features after removing redundant langsys and prune_features
152 hb_map_t gsub_features;
153 hb_map_t gpos_features;
154
155 //active feature variation records/condition index with variations
156 hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, hb::shared_ptr<hb_set_t>> gsub_feature_record_cond_idx_map;
157 hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, hb::shared_ptr<hb_set_t>> gpos_feature_record_cond_idx_map;
158
159 //feature index-> address of substituation feature table mapping with
160 //variations
161 hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, const OT::Feature*> gsub_feature_substitutes_map;
162 hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, const OT::Feature*> gpos_feature_substitutes_map;
163
164 //active layers/palettes we'd like to retain
165 hb_map_t colrv1_layers;
166 hb_map_t colr_palettes;
167
168 //Old layout item variation index -> (New varidx, delta) mapping
169 hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, hb_pair_t<unsigned, int>> layout_variation_idx_delta_map;
170
171 //gdef varstore retained varidx mapping
172 hb_vector_t<hb_inc_bimap_t> gdef_varstore_inner_maps;
173
174 hb_hashmap_t<hb_tag_t, hb::unique_ptr<hb_blob_t>> sanitized_table_cache;
175 //normalized axes location map
176 hb_hashmap_t<hb_tag_t, int> axes_location;
177 hb_vector_t<int> normalized_coords;
178 //user specified axes location map
179 hb_hashmap_t<hb_tag_t, float> user_axes_location;
180 //retained old axis index -> new axis index mapping in fvar axis array
181 hb_map_t axes_index_map;
182 //axis_index->axis_tag mapping in fvar axis array
183 hb_map_t axes_old_index_tag_map;
184 bool all_axes_pinned;
185 bool pinned_at_default;
186 bool has_seac;
187
188 //hmtx metrics map: new gid->(advance, lsb)
189 mutable hb_hashmap_t<hb_codepoint_t, hb_pair_t<unsigned, int>> hmtx_map;
190 //vmtx metrics map: new gid->(advance, lsb)
191 mutable hb_hashmap_t<hb_codepoint_t, hb_pair_t<unsigned, int>> vmtx_map;
192 //boundsWidth map: new gid->boundsWidth, boundWidth=xMax - xMin
193 mutable hb_map_t bounds_width_map;
194 //boundsHeight map: new gid->boundsHeight, boundsHeight=yMax - yMin
195 mutable hb_map_t bounds_height_map;
196
197 //recalculated head/maxp table info after instancing
198 mutable head_maxp_info_t head_maxp_info;
199
200#ifdef HB_EXPERIMENTAL_API
201 // name table overrides map: hb_ot_name_record_ids_t-> name string new value or
202 // None to indicate should remove
203 hb_hashmap_t<hb_ot_name_record_ids_t, hb_bytes_t> name_table_overrides;
204#endif
205
206 const hb_subset_accelerator_t* accelerator;
207 hb_subset_accelerator_t* inprogress_accelerator;
208
209 public:
210
211 template<typename T>
212 hb_blob_ptr_t<T> source_table()
213 {
214 hb_lock_t (accelerator ? &accelerator->sanitized_table_cache_lock : nullptr);
215
216 auto *cache = accelerator ? &accelerator->sanitized_table_cache : &sanitized_table_cache;
217 if (cache
218 && !cache->in_error ()
219 && cache->has (+T::tableTag)) {
220 return hb_blob_reference (cache->get (key: +T::tableTag).get ());
221 }
222
223 hb::unique_ptr<hb_blob_t> table_blob {hb_sanitize_context_t ().reference_table<T> (source)};
224 hb_blob_t* ret = hb_blob_reference (blob: table_blob.get ());
225
226 if (likely (cache))
227 cache->set (+T::tableTag, std::move (table_blob));
228
229 return ret;
230 }
231
232 bool in_error () const { return !successful; }
233
234 bool check_success(bool success)
235 {
236 successful = (successful && success);
237 return successful;
238 }
239
240 /*
241 * The set of input glyph ids which will be retained in the subset.
242 * Does NOT include ids kept due to retain_gids. You probably want to use
243 * glyph_map/reverse_glyph_map.
244 */
245 inline const hb_set_t *
246 glyphset () const
247 {
248 return &_glyphset;
249 }
250
251 /*
252 * The set of input glyph ids which will be retained in the subset.
253 */
254 inline const hb_set_t *
255 glyphset_gsub () const
256 {
257 return &_glyphset_gsub;
258 }
259
260 /*
261 * The total number of output glyphs in the final subset.
262 */
263 inline unsigned int
264 num_output_glyphs () const
265 {
266 return _num_output_glyphs;
267 }
268
269 /*
270 * Given an output gid , returns true if that glyph id is an empty
271 * glyph (ie. it's a gid that we are dropping all data for).
272 */
273 inline bool is_empty_glyph (hb_codepoint_t gid) const
274 {
275 return !_glyphset.has (k: gid);
276 }
277
278 inline bool new_gid_for_codepoint (hb_codepoint_t codepoint,
279 hb_codepoint_t *new_gid) const
280 {
281 hb_codepoint_t old_gid = codepoint_to_glyph->get (key: codepoint);
282 if (old_gid == HB_MAP_VALUE_INVALID)
283 return false;
284
285 return new_gid_for_old_gid (old_gid, new_gid);
286 }
287
288 inline bool new_gid_for_old_gid (hb_codepoint_t old_gid,
289 hb_codepoint_t *new_gid) const
290 {
291 hb_codepoint_t gid = glyph_map->get (key: old_gid);
292 if (gid == HB_MAP_VALUE_INVALID)
293 return false;
294
295 *new_gid = gid;
296 return true;
297 }
298
299 inline bool old_gid_for_new_gid (hb_codepoint_t new_gid,
300 hb_codepoint_t *old_gid) const
301 {
302 hb_codepoint_t gid = reverse_glyph_map->get (key: new_gid);
303 if (gid == HB_MAP_VALUE_INVALID)
304 return false;
305
306 *old_gid = gid;
307 return true;
308 }
309
310 inline bool
311 add_table (hb_tag_t tag,
312 hb_blob_t *contents)
313 {
314 if (HB_DEBUG_SUBSET)
315 {
316 hb_blob_t *source_blob = source->reference_table (tag);
317 DEBUG_MSG(SUBSET, nullptr, "add table %c%c%c%c, dest %u bytes, source %u bytes",
318 HB_UNTAG(tag),
319 hb_blob_get_length (contents),
320 hb_blob_get_length (source_blob));
321 hb_blob_destroy (blob: source_blob);
322 }
323 return hb_face_builder_add_table (face: dest, tag, blob: contents);
324 }
325};
326
327#endif /* HB_SUBSET_PLAN_HH */
328
